data.title: Used Perazzi MX8 or New Beretta 692 Xtrap
data.text:
For all you guy's recommending a used Perazzi to this poster I would like you to consider something.

I totally agree all things being equal the Perazzi MX8 is the superior shotgun by far.

But you are recommending a used competition shotgun with a lot of unknowns.

For instance it is my observation that some competitive shooters like to "tune" their gun's mechanical's thinking this will help them be better.

I have seen once or twice one of these used guns getting bought by a trusting buyer.

I have witnessed doubling issues from trigger work done by an unknown gunsmith.

I have read of barrel work done to these guns but why someone would know better than Perazzi how these barrels should perform I cannot understand.

Am I being overly concerned here? If it was me buying I would want to know the original owner and the complete history of that MX8 or any other expensive high end shotgun before buying.

For all you guy's recommending a used Perazzi to this poster I would like you to consider something.

I totally agree all things being equal the Perazzi MX8 is the superior shotgun by far.

But you are recommending a used competition shotgun with a lot of unknowns.

For instance it is my observation that some competitive shooters like to "tune" their gun's mechanical's thinking this will help them be better.

I have seen once or twice one of these used guns getting bought by a trusting buyer.

I have witnessed doubling issues from trigger work done by an unknown gunsmith.

I have read of barrel work done to these guns but why someone would know better than Perazzi how these barrels should perform I cannot understand.

Am I being overly concerned here? If it was me buying I would want to know the original owner and the complete history of that MX8 or any other expensive high end shotgun before buying.

Well, yea. But, we all know there a more than a few REALLY GOOD gunsmiths that work on Perazzi guns and can fix almost anything (Except barrels some knuckle head decided needed to be "improved" by back boring or drilling holes in or some such nonsense.)

I personally live close enough to Lucio Sosta that I would never let anyone but him touch my guns. (And of course, it is easy enough to send him a gun or part of one and it is probably 3/4 of his work.)But all you have to do is ask for a good Perazzi mechanic on this web site and you will get many who can help.

Attachments

319 KB Views: 163

Well if you think that by spending 3 times the money to get a better mousetrap will make you a shoot better. fill your boots.

You force me to respond.

Perazzi has been used by more clay sports shooters to win major championships than ALL other guns combined world wide and in the US since about 1980. That is, Olympics, World Cups, ATA events (Grand American events, Zone shoots, State shoots etc.), Skeet championships both international and American, Sporting Clays and the unrecorded pigeon shoots. Perazzis have been and are shot by more ATA All Americans than all other guns combined. (Ever hear of a guy named Dan Bonillas?)

Here is a list of Olympian Champions since 1996:

1996 Atlanta

Kim Rhode USA. Double Trap Ladies. Gold. Model MX12.

Michael Diamond AUS. Olympic Trap. Gold. Model MX8.

Josh Lakatos USA. Olympic Trap. Silver. Model MX10.

Lance Bade USA. Olympic Trap. Bronze. Model MX8.

2000 Sydney

Michael Diamond AUS. Olympic Trap. Gold. Model MX8.

Daina Gudzineviciute LTU. Olympic Trap Ladies. Gold. Model MX8.

Zemfira Meftakhetdinova AZE. Olympic Skeet Ladies. Gold. Model MX8.

Deborah Gelisio ITA. Double Trap Ladies. Silver. Model MX2000/8.

Giovanni Pellielo ITA. Olympic Trap. Silver. Model MX8.

Fehaid Al-Deehani KUW. Double Trap. Bronze. Model MX8.

Kim Rhode USA. Double Trap Ladies. Bronze. Model MX12.

James Graves USA. Olympic Skeet. Bronze. Model MX8.

Diana Igaly HUN. Olympic Skeet Ladies. Bronze. Model MX8.

2004 Athens

Aleksey Alipov RUS. Olympic Trap. Gold. Model MX8.

Suzanne Balogh AUS. Olympic Trap Ladies. Gold. Model MX8.

Kim Rhode USA. Double Trap Ladies. Gold. Model MX12.

Diana Igaly HUN. Olympic Skeet Ladies. Gold. Model SC3.

Maria Quintanal ESP. Olympic Trap Ladies. Silver. Model MX2000/8.

Lee Bo-na KOR. Double Trap Ladies. Silver. Model MX8.

Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore IND. Double Trap. Silver. Model MX8.

Marko Kemppainen FIN. Olympic Skeet. Silver. Model MX2000/8.

Lee Bo-na KOR. Olympic Trap Ladies. Bronze. Model MX8.

Wang Zheng CHN. Double Trap. Bronze. Model MX2000/8.

Zemfira Meftakhetdinova AZE. Olympic Skeet Ladies. Bronze. Model MX8.

Juan Miguel Rodriguez CUB. Olympic Skeet. Bronze. Model MX8.

2012 London

Peter Wilson GBR. Double Trap. Gold. Model MX2005.

Giovanni Cernogoraz CRO. Olympic Trap. Gold. Model MX2000/8.

Kim Rhode. USA. Olympic Skeet Ladies. Gold. Model MX2000/S.

Jessica Rossi ITA. Olympic Trap Ladies. Gold. Model MX8.

Zuzana Stefecekova SVK. Olympic Trap Ladies. Silver. Model MX2000/3.

Hakan Dahlby SWE. Double Trap. Silver. Model MX2008.

Massimo Fabbrizi ITA. Olympic Trap. Silver. Model MX8.

Anders Golding DEN. Olympic Skeet. Silver. Model MX2000/8

Vasily Mosin RUS. Double Trap. Bronze. Model MX2008.

Fehaid Al-Deehani KUW. Olympic Trap. Bronze. Model MX2005.

Delphine Reau FRA. Olympic Trap Ladies. Bronze. Model MX8.

Danka Bartekova SVK. Olympic Skeet Ladies. Bronze. Model MX8.

Look up the champions in the shotgun sport of your choice. Perazzi absolutely dominates.

Oh, and as for me, I am an old trapshooter who also likes to shoot lots of other clay sports. I got to AA27AA on the back of my Perazzi and yes, I sure as hell do think it "makes me shoot better."

Wanna list the Beretta achievements during the same time?

(By the way, what does "fill your boots" mean?)
